lines.text:
[singing]
I'm known as Rich King Midas / And when you look at me / You'll see a king / Who knows a thing / About his treasury / I never cared for women / I've never cared for wine / But when I count / A large amount / Of money - Ha ha! - It's divine / Gold, gold, gold! / I worship it, I love it / Gold, gold, gold! / I wish I had more of it / My love for shining gold is such / That I could never have too much / I wish that everything I touched / Would turn to gold, gold gold!
Who art thou, stranger?
A friend. Just call me Goldie.
What do you want? My gold?
I, want that paltry gold? Ha ha! 'Tis like chicken feed to me. Behold!
[Touches Midas' cat and turns it to gold]
The golden touch!
[Grabs the gold cat, but Goldie stops him and turns the cat back to normal]
My gold! My kingdom! Everything for the golden touch!
[Starts taking off his coat]
Keep thy shirt on, old king. To you the golden touch would prove a golden curse.
A curse? A curse? Ha! Then curse me with the golden touch! Ha ha ha ha!
Ah, but gold is the snare of the soul. Gold is the root of all evil. Gold is the...
Fiddlesticks! Give me gold, not advice.
So be it. I gave thee advise. Now I give thee gold. The golden touch is thine. Toodle-oo!

[to his reflection]
Hail, Midas. Ha ha ha! Thou, rascal, thou. Shall we turn the Earth to gold? The rivers, the mountains, the stars, the moon, the sky... a universe of gold!
Ah, is this the great man who bellowed, "Give me gold, not advise"?
Goldie, Goldie! Help me, Goldie! Take away this golden curse! Don't let me starve! Take everything! My gold, my kingdom for a hamburger sandwich!
With or without onions?
Hamburger! Just plain old hamburger!
Ha ha ha! Now thou art a wise and humble king. I will take back the golden touch in exchange for everything you possess. Toodle-oo!

[to his reflection]
Is the richest king in all the world to starve to death?
[Reflection turns into a skeleton and nods]
